name: Mercure Resort Hunter Valley Gardens

reviews.title: Service & Room Layout
reviews.text: Had long wait for Dinner in Steakhouse because the bartender couldn't find an ingredient for a Martini !!!!. TV in room should be able to rotate instead of being fixed to wall. Would allow sitting in lounge/seat to watch, not in bed. Room is for two (2) people, only one (1) chair. What happens if meal is had in room where does the other person sit.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Otherwise liked the Hotel very much, location great, meal (after we got it) was lovely,
reviews.title: Wonderful Weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location to walk ,rather than driving.
reviews.title: We had a great stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You can stroll around the block(about 7kms.) get a coffee on the way,or hit a couple of wineries,restaraunts and shops.
reviews.title: Some maintenance issues. Could do better

reviews.text: The steak house at the resort was excellent ,with great menu and wine list.
reviews.title: Very pleasant stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I love that this place has traditional aspects but is still very modern. The gardens are gorgeous and the room we stayed in had a semi-private courtyard out the door with comfy table and chairs. From this we could walk to the delightful pool and spa.
reviews.title: Love it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We go to the Hunter for Day On the Green concerts, and love that you can still get a drink and food afterwards here. The restaurant does a fine buffet brekkie too, which is cheaper if you book the night before.
reviews.title: Wine Tasting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful sunken bath with pebble wall behind it and glass ceiling above. Lovely king bed with choice of pillows.
reviews.title: Great - Can't wait to go back!!

reviews.text: Only down side to this place is that it's pretty expensive, but we'll still go back because it's our favourite in the region.
reviews.title: Would stay again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel and surounding gardenings are beautiful. Very relaxing! within walking distance to 3 cellar doors, and 2 cheese shops!! Near by is the Irish Pub, 500mtr walk good food, and wine tasting. There is Hunter Valley Gardens, beautiful! Great location to have a fabulous time, we will go back again...
reviews.title: Mercure - wine tasting tour

reviews.text: A lovely hotel in a beautiful location. Reception area nice and staff all very friendly and helpful. Room was nicely decorated and well equipped, with little terrace area out the back. We used the pool and although a bit chilly at first it was great to have it there as some of the days were very hot.We didn't use the restaurant so can't comment on that. The location is fantastic as it is only 5 mins walk to the Hunter Valley gardens and the village with quite a few shops and cafes. Would definitely recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Beautiful location

reviews.text: We stayed at this place for two nights in Februray 2013 and it was a dissapontment from start to end. Not clean room when we arrived, dusty tables and dirty floor. The next day they had not done anything more than make the bed an change the towles! The internet was so slow it took minutes to open one page and the price for it is the 25 dollars and it's just way too much! The breakfast was poor and tasteless. The staff did not realy care about the cleanness or the internet charge.
reviews.title: Do not stay here!

reviews.text: Would never stay here again, so many other nice places to choose from in Hunter Valley!
reviews.title: Disappointed.

reviews.text: On a rainy weekend in the Hunter Valley it was lovely to get back into a cosy room for a nice soak in the large bath. The breakfast was great with so much to choose from. Staff very welcoming and great service all round.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: Went to a Concert at the Hope Estate across the road from the mercury - very close. Mecure has beautiful rooms, lovely pool area, shops, restaurants, cafes, a pub all within the complex. Mcguigans Winery right at the back of the Mecure and Tempest 2 Winery across the road.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are booking I would suggest a ground floor room as you get a little courtyard with table & chairs. Rang reception to see if we could have WiFi in our room - next morning got a bill for $24 for one night and were never advised we would have to pay. I think all Internet should be free.
reviews.title: Worth returning!

reviews.text: All in all a great location to stay.
reviews.title: Hunter Mercure was perfect

aka: Mercure Resort Hunter Valley Gardens Hotel
